title: SEM-CLIP: Precise Few-Shot Learning for Nanoscale Defect Detection in Scanning Electron Microscope Image
author: Qian Jin (Zhejiang University), Yumeng Liu (Zhejiang University), Yuqi Jiang (Zhejiang University), Yining Chen (Zhejiang University, HIC-ZJU), Qi Sun (Zhejiang University), Dawei Gao (Zhejiang University, HIC-ZJU), Xudong Lu (Zhejiang University), Cheng Zhuo (Zhejiang University), ...
relevance_why: The proposed SEM-CLIP framework's few-shot learning approach for defect classification and segmentation could inspire similar methods in the audio domain, particularly in tasks requiring minimal labeled data.
background: Few-shot learning is employed to detect and classify defects in scanning electron microscope images with limited annotated data.
contribution: This paper introduces SEM-CLIP to solve the challenge of nanoscale defect detection in semiconductor manufacturing, achieving high accuracy even with few examples.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods for defect detection often rely on large labeled datasets, limiting their usability in real-world industrial applications.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon standard approaches by integrating customized language-image pretraining combined with few-shot learning techniques.

key_innovation: It utilizes enriched text prompts from domain knowledge and dual-path attention mechanisms to minimize background noise in defect detection.
real_world_impact: The method could lead to significant improvements in semiconductor manufacturing processes by reducing the labor required for defect labeling and analysis, thus facilitating more efficient production.
limitations: The paper does not discuss potential generalizability issues when applied to other sectors beyond semiconductor manufacturing.

new_terms.Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM): **Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM)** is a type of electron microscope that produces images of a sample by scanning it with a focused beam of electrons, widely used for high-resolution imaging of materials.
